newsitem.title: USA: CFTC to ask for greater oversight of LME - Born.
newsitem.headline: CFTC to ask for greater oversight of LME - Born.

text.p: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is preparing to tell the British Securities and Investments Board (SIB) to increase oversight of the London Metal Exchange, the commission chairwoman said.

The two regulators are jointly investigating the Sumitomo Corp copper trading scandal to see if the company illegally manipulated prices. Much of Sumitomo's copper trading took place on the LME, away from stringent U.S. laws on disclosure and leverage.
The CFTC is finalizing comments in response to a request from the SIB seeking input about regulation of the LME, chairwoman Brooksley Born said Thursday.

"Our comments will point out some comparative strengths of the U.S. regulatory system and will encourage the SIB to adopt appropriate measures to strengthen its oversight of the LME," Born said in a prepared text of a speech delivered in Chicago at a conference of the Commodities Law Institute.
Japanese authorities arrested Sumitomo's former top copper trader Yasuo Hamanaka on Tuesday. The CFTC declined to comment on the arrest but said its investigation is ongoing.
"Our investigation is continuing. We are cooperating closely with authorities in both Japan and the U.K.," Born told reporters at a press conference after the luncheon speech."
